Be ready to read. Be ready to study. And always talk in class, with relative material.
IUSB is a great school. The professors in my program are passionate and ready to fill you with knowledge. The tuition here isn't bad at all.

TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {174206=The professors are knowledgable, but the thoroughness of the advisors is questionable. It not only is a good place to eat, it's also nice to study. There are several options available at lunch time., 63085=IUSB just re-did The Grille and I must say that the food is very good and worth the price ! textAfterTable: I am currently a freshman majoring in Mechanical Engineering. I am learning a lot from these classes. Login to rate or flag the reviews Tori from South Bend, IN 09/15/2011 Reviewer is A current student here. 3 out of 3 people found this review useful. 3 of 49 Categories Comments Tips for prospective students I would strongly suggest that prospective students come for a visit to the Univeristy. The Office of Admissions offers campus visits 4 days each week where you receive a guided tour of campus from a current student and have the chance to sit down with an admissions counselor one-on-one. There are also Showcase Days offered once each month where students can come for a visit and have the chance to speak with someone from the major they are interested in. Coming for a visit will help students to see all that IU South Bend has to offer.
